title: Freedmen's Bureau Records: W. Storer How to Orlando Brown, December 11, 1865
summary: How submits a summary of conditions in the Sixth Sub-District, of which Augusta County was a part at this time. Although he does not mention Augusta County, directly, How discusses the problem of poor relief, and the need to have troops stationed in each county, if the Bureau's work is to be effective.
keywords: Administration/Bureaucracy, Aid/Relief, Military Authority, Race Relations, American Civil War
